abstract: Scientists have begun using computational techniques and study of ancient DNA in effort to settle long debate over origin of proto-Indo-European language, ancient tongue considered to be basis of all Indo-European languages, including English; new research seems to indicate that root language more likely originated 6,500 years ago on European steppes, not 8,500 years ago in Turkey as suggested.
lead_paragraph: The precursor to many modern languages, including English, was probably spread by force, not farming.
snippet: The precursor to many modern languages, including English, was probably spread by force, not farming.
